text: So some papers on that are due to come out in 2021

elements.text: So some papers on that are due to come out in 2021

text:
Great, looking forward to it! I'm writing my own proposal for a doctoral project in which I aim to use UDEs via SciML. I know the first question from other scientists working on these models will be: "Why not just use Ensemble Kalman filters?" and other "state-of-the-art" techniques.

The best answer I can come up with so far is that UDEs should (theoretically) better address epistemic uncertainty from missing dynamics in the model, whereas traditional filtering approaches can't really do this directly. They just try to "adjust" the model to better fit the data.

Great, looking forward to it! I'm writing my own proposal for a doctoral project in which I aim to use UDEs via SciML. I know the first question from other scientists working on these models will be: "Why not just use Ensemble Kalman filters?" and other "state-of-the-art" techniques.

The best answer I can come up with so far is that UDEs should (theoretically) better address epistemic uncertainty from missing dynamics in the model, whereas traditional filtering approaches can't really do this directly. They just try to "adjust" the model to better fit the data.

text: yes, and there's a lot of exciting stuff to look at in that area,

elements.text: yes, and there's a lot of exciting stuff to look at in that area,
